@DrLauraVivanco She's good. Still missing smoking but she limits herself to only eating chocolate at the weekend now.

@jegteg It seems to me people are more interested in taking a political scalp rather than hearing the truth.
Witnesses, inc. SNP staff, gave evidence saying he was innocent but people want to see him in court (where, no doubt, the same witnesses would still say he's innocent).
@valhalla1965 @rapecrisisscot @Eileen43Eileen You do that. Bye.

@valhalla1965 @rapecrisisscot @Eileen43Eileen Aye, despite those witnesses including staff who work for the SNP, they all lied to protect a Tory MSP.
Do you have any idea how demented that sounds?

@vFreeBirdv @valhalla1965 @rapecrisisscot @Eileen43Eileen There may be better ways to deal with it but in this case it seems to me people are more upset because they didn't get a media circus and a political scalp rather than the discovering the truth.

It's amazing how many people who claim that Alex Salmond is the victim of some political conspiracy regarding sexual misconduct allegations are happy to believe that Miles Briggs is guilty despite the many witnesses who say he's innocent.
Utter crackpots.

@valhalla1965 @rapecrisisscot @Eileen43Eileen He has the right to prove his innocent. And he did. He was cleared of any wrongdoing because witnesses, inc. those of rival political parties, said he did nothing wrong.
Why is this innocent man having his name sullied by this action?

@valhalla1965 @rapecrisisscot @Eileen43Eileen According to witnesses, including staff working for other parties inc. the SNP, he didn't do anything wrong so what do you want people to do? Pretend he's guilty so you can label him a sexual predator?

@rapecrisisscot Even witnesses working for rival parties said he was innocent. I dislike the Tories as much as any other sane person but this is victimising an innocent man. And it's politicising sexual assault for your own ends.

@rapecrisisscot Miles Briggs said: "I was able to supply the party's disciplinary committee with several witness statements from individuals who were with me the entire evening ... I am especially grateful to the SNP parliamentary researchers who were among those who supported my case."
@Scotpol1314 @Balr0g https://t.co/2V6WWLkOYD
@Scotpol1314 @Balr0g Okay, well you're clearly howling at the moon. Bye.
@Scotpol1314 @Balr0g I think you're allowing your emotions to get the better of you, pal.
@Scotpol1314 @Balr0g What double standards? So far, I've seen the Miles Briggs story reported in the Daily Record, the Sun, the Scotsman, the Herald, The National and BBC Scotland.
Good. Leave it there. https://t.co/jwLMDweyXZ

@KizzieWiz @Jeggit Care to expand on what you mean by 'suspect'?
Is it, as I 'suspect', that they vote for what they stand for rather than towing to the SNP every time?

@Scotpol1314 @Balr0g Then you're pretty deluded. You honestly think a no mark MSP whose party isn't even in Government is going to get as much coverage as a former First Minister? Come on, behave yourself.

@McBOTtheIndyman @Isthisabot For voting against a policy they don't agree with? A policy they said they were against in their 2016 manifesto?
By all means disagree but having a go at a party for standing by what they believe in is bizarre. It's a pity others, inc. the SNP, don't always do likewise.
@SamsHusband You just know that's tempting fate!
RT @allangrogan: So the greens are now tories?Honestly SNP there wont be a need for Better Together next timesome of your supporters are do…

Of course, the next time the SNP vote with the Tories in Holyrood, this place is going to be full of angry indy supporters tearing into the SNP and resigning their memberships.
Otherwise, they're a bunch of hypocrites.

RT @AFaulds: SNP Supporters; You can't trust Labour anymore, all those broken promises
Also SNP Supporters; Oh come now Greens, you have t…

@realdaydoh @PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon You'd have to ask them. It's nothing to do with the Greens. The Greens voted against a policy they disagreed with. People saying the voted with the Tories need to grow up. All parties vote for and against policies, sometimes on their own and sometimes with other parties.

@MarkBarry67 @PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon It was in the Tory manifesto. The voted against it today because they were playing politics. It's still a Tory policy that the SNP lifted from their manifesto. Maybe chew on that for a while.

@MarkBarry67 @PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon The Greens voted againast what is effectively a Tory policy being pitched by the SNP.
Perhaps people should direct their anger at the SNP for trying to implement Tory policies rather than the Greens for voting against them.

@MarkBarry67 @PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon My comment was an ironic response to the original post but the replies have certainly cemented my belief that the SNP are full of strange cultists. Also, there's the fact that the SNP are happy to steal Tory policies but we'll just ignore that.

@Fagashlil76 @NewTownSpeed @jikdmmen @MichelleGr4h4m @PoliticsScot @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon Also, the SNP have hardly covered themselves in glory. The very policy everyone is arguing over was actually a Tory policy that the SNP lifted from their manifesto. Perhaps some SNPers could take time to reflect upon that. It might expose some truths about the SNP they don't like

@Fagashlil76 @NewTownSpeed @jikdmmen @MichelleGr4h4m @PoliticsScot @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon I've had 4 years of putting up with bullsh*t from SNPers. Attacks on anyone who disagrees with the SNP on anything. Conspiracy theories. Being called a Yoon because I criticise the SNP from time to time.
It's put me off voting Yes in future. Imagine how it looks to undecideds?

@PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon Ah, so you agree that it was a Tory policy then? Maybe you should point that out to your fellow Yessers who've spent the night attacking the Greens for voting against a policy they disagree with.
The Greens voted against a Tory policy that the SNP tried to implement.

@WullieForIndy And how many times have the SNP voted with the Tories? Will you condemn them the next time they do so? The SNP & Tories have voted together far more times than the Greens have voted with the Tories.
Again, this was originally a Tory policy which the SNP stole. Unpalatable truth.
@Murdo01 @MichelleGr4h4m @jikdmmen @PoliticsScot @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon Loony.

@WullieForIndy You are aware that the SNP lifted this policy straight from the Tory manifesto? Maybe the expression Tartan Tories is apt at this time. Or you can just pretend it's not true (even though it is) and go back to spouting shit about SNPbad.

@PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon You're angry because the Greens voted against a policy which the SNP stole from the Tories?
I wonder how many of the SNPers arguing in favour of the policy would be doing so if it was the Tories who put it to Parliament? Very few I imagine.
@jikdmmen @PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon Who's David?

Lots of SNPers angry tonight because the Greens voted against a policy that the SNP stole from the Tories.
Strange times.

@PoliticsScot @jikdmmen @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon Oh, and by the way, the SNP lifted this policy directly from the Tory manifesto. Maybe you should have a think about that before attacking parties for standing by what they believe.

@PoliticsScot @jikdmmen @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon They voted against the policy because that's what they said they would do from the very start. You may disagree with that stance but attacking the Greens for standing by their promises is pretty disgraceful and exposes many in the indy movement as little more than SNP cultists.

@Credo1611 @PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon The P1 testing was a Tory policy. The SNP lifted it from the Tory manifesto.
Make of that what you will.

@PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon The Greens stood by their manifesto pledge and explained the reasons why. If you can't understand that simple concept then that's your problem. Of course, we all know the real reason is because you're upset they voted against the SNP and you're acting like a big kid.

@jikdmmen @PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon Do you want a list of all the times the SNP and Tories have voted together? It's considerably more times than the Greens have voted with the Tories.
Don't forget, P1 assessment was originally a Tory policy the SNP stole off them.

@PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon You said you're never voting Green again because they voted for a commitment they made in their OWN manifesto. Quite a ridiculous argument really isn't it?

@PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @jikdmmen @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon I look forward to your comments the next time the SNP and Tories vote together. Which should be soon.
Of course, you'll denounce the SNP and threaten never to vote for them again. Otherwise, you're just another hypocrite spouting meaningless shit on Twitter.

@MichelleGr4h4m @PoliticsScot @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon You're clearly insane. You enjoy the rest of your life posting garbage on Twitter (which is about all you ever seem to do to be honest). 74k tweets in five years. Wow.
@Murdo01 @MichelleGr4h4m @jikdmmen @PoliticsScot @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon Nice to hear from you loony cultist.
@MichelleGr4h4m @NewTownSpeed @jikdmmen @PoliticsScot @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon And you're clearly just another rambling, paranoid cultist who sees unionists hiding behind every hedge.

@PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon The SNP, as the Scottish gov't, set the example. But, as someone who said they wont vote Green again because they stood by their own manifesto commitment, I don't expect you to understand. I look forward to reading your comments the next time the SNP vote with the Tories.
@MichelleGr4h4m @jikdmmen @PoliticsScot @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon Aye, okay.
@jikdmmen @MichelleGr4h4m @PoliticsScot @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon Let's just say I've gone off the idea having experienced the SNP and their followers at close quarters.

@MichelleGr4h4m @PoliticsScot @patrickharvie @NicolaSturgeon I campaigned for Yes (you're welcome to trawl back several years) but the SNP cultists and loonies have put me right off the idea. If attacking anyone with the guts to disagree with the SNP is what an indy Scotland will be like then it's not something to aspire to be a part of.

@PoliticsScot @MichelleGr4h4m @patrickharvie Hey SNPers. The next time you have an independence referendum I wont be voting yes because the SNP and their followers have proved themselves to be the biggest bunch of hypocrites in politics @NicolaSturgeon

@Pmacgiollabhain Just putting things into context you understand. Not trying to put anyone off their dinner (especially if they're eating meat while raging about a goat being shot).

@Pmacgiollabhain On the one hand the goat died instantly. On the other hand lambs, cows & pigs get reared, driven to an abattoir and have their throats slit. In industrial slaughterhouses, chickens are killed prior to scalding by being passed through an electrified water-bath while shackled.
